title: NVIDIA 2025 Financial Analysis: Strengths, Risks, and Market Outlook
content: NVIDIA‚Äôs 2025 income statement demonstrates robust fundamentals, with revenue reaching $130.5B and net income at $72.9B. Key profitability metrics are strong, including a gross margin of 75% and an EBIT margin of 64.6%, both favorable. Operating expenses grew proportionally with revenue, supporting sustainable growth. The company also maintained low interest expenses relative to revenue, contributing to a net margin of 55.9%. Overall, the financial data indicates a favorable income performance [...] NVIDIA Corporation shows strong profitability with a net profit margin of 55.85% in 2025 and a high ROIC of 75.28%, well above its WACC of 14.46%, indicating significant value creation. The company maintains low debt levels with a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.13. Fundamentals have improved markedly in revenue and margins, supported by an A- rating reflecting solid financial health and performance. These factors could be seen as signaling robust operational efficiency and financial stability. [

# NVIDIA 2025 Financial Analysis: Strengths, Risks, and Market Outlook

NVIDIA Corporation revolutionizes the way we experience computing and digital interaction, powering everything from immersive gaming to cutting-edge artificial intelligence. As a dominant force in the semiconductor industry, NVIDIA‚Äôs GeForce GPUs, AI-driven data center platforms, and innovative software solutions set industry standards for performance and quality. With a robust market presence and relentless innovation, the key question for investors in 2025 is whether NVIDIA‚Äôs strong fundamentals continue to support its lofty valuation and future growth prospects.

Table of contents

* [Company Description](#company-description)
* [Fundamental Analysis](#fundamental-analysis)
* [Sector Analysis](#sector-analysis)
* [Stock Analysis](#stock-analysis)
* [Analyst Opinions](#analyst-opinions)
* [Consumer Opinions](#consumer-opinions)
* [Risk Analysis](#risk-analysis)
* [Should You Buy NVIDIA Corporation?](#should-you-buy-nvidia-corporation)

## Company Description

NVIDIA Corporation, founded in 1993 and headquartered in Santa Clara, California, is a dominant player in the **semiconductors** industry. It specializes in high-performance graphics processing units (GPUs) for gaming, professional visualization, data centers, and automotive applications. Its product portfolio spans hardware like GeForce and NVIDIA RTX GPUs, alongside software platforms such as Omniverse and [AI](https://artificall.com/analysis/sectors/artificial-intelligence/) Enterprise. Operating globally across the US, Taiwan, and China, NVIDIA‚Äôs integrated approach combining hardware, software, and services positions it at the forefront of AI innovation and accelerated computing, shaping the future of multiple technology sectors.

## Fundamental Analysis

This section examines NVIDIA Corporation‚Äôs income statement, key financial ratios, and dividend payout policy to evaluate its financial health and investment potential.

### Income Statement

The table below summarizes NVIDIA Corporation‚Äôs key income statement figures for fiscal years 2021 through 2025, reflecting revenue, expenses, profits, and earnings per share.

| **2021** | **2022** | **2023** | **2024** | **2025** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **Revenue** | 16.7B | 26.9B | 27.0B | 60.9B | 130.5B |
| **Cost of Revenue** | 6.3B | 9.4B | 11.6B | 16.6B | 32.6B |
| **Operating Expenses** | 5.9B | 7.4B | 11.1B | 11.3B | 16.4B |
| **Gross Profit** | 10.4B | 17.5B | 15.4B | 44.3B | 97.9B |
| **EBITDA** | 5.7B | 11.4B | 6.0B | 35.6B | 86.1B |
| **EBIT** | 4.6B | 10.2B | 4.4B | 34.1B | 84.3B |
| **Interest Expense** | 0.18B | 0.24B | 0.26B | 0.26B | 0.25B |
| **Net Income** | 4.3B | 9.8B | 4.4B | 29.8B | 72.9B |
| **EPS** | 0.18 | 0.39 | 0.18 | 1.21 | 2.97 |
| **Filing Date** | 2021-02-26 | 2022-03-18 | 2023-02-24 | 2024-02-21 | 2025-02-26 |

title: NVIDIA Corp (NVDA)'s Winning Formula: Financial Metrics and Comp
content: Ranked highly in Growth, NVIDIA Corp demonstrates a strong commitment to expanding its business. The company's 3-Year Revenue Growth Rate is 70.5%, which outperforms better than 97.02% of 973 companies in the Semiconductors industry. Moreover, NVIDIA Corp has seen a robust increase in its earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization (EBITDA) over the past few years. Specifically, the three-year growth rate stands at 97.9, and the rate over the past five years is 82.3. This [...] The Profitability Rank shows NVIDIA Corp's impressive standing among its peers in generating profit. NVIDIA Corp's Operating Margin has increased by 139.45% over the past five years, as shown by the following data: 2021: 27.18; 2022: 37.31; 2023: 20.68; 2024: 54.12; 2025: 62.42. Furthermore, NVIDIA Corp's Gross Margin has seen a consistent rise over the past five years, as evidenced by the data: 2021: 62.34; 2022: 64.93; 2023: 56.93; 2024: 72.72; 2025: 74.99. This trend underscores the [...]

The company‚Äôs financial performance‚Äîwith revenue growth exceeding 100% and gross margins around 76%‚Äîdemonstrates both market leadership and pricing power. | Gross Margin | 76% | 53% | 45% | 58% |

 Gross Margin: 75.98% (industry-leading profitability)
 Operating Cash Flow: $68.9 billion (massive cash generation)

# Nvidia Is Breaking Out, Don't Get Left Behind

Dec. 24, 2025 5:42 PM ET[NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) Stock](/symbol/NVDA#source=section%3Amain_content%7Csection_asset%3Ameta%7Cfirst_level_url%3Aarticle%7Csymbol%3ANVDA), [NVDA:CA Stock](/symbol/NVDA:CA#source=section%3Amain_content%7Csection_asset%3Ameta%7Cfirst_level_url%3Aarticle%7Csymbol%3ANVDA%3ACA), [ZNVD:CA Stock](/symbol/ZNVD:CA#source=section%3Amain_content%7Csection_asset%3Ameta%7Cfirst_level_url%3Aarticle%7Csymbol%3AZNVD%3ACA)

[StockBros Research](/author/stockbros-research#source=url_first_level%3Aarticle%7Csection%3Aauthor_brief%3Astockbros-research%7Csection_asset%3Aauthor_brief%7Cauthor_name)

3.19KFollowers

* [Comment

  (1)](/article/4855681-nvidia-is-breaking-out-dont-get-left-behind#scroll_comments)

## Summary

* Nvidia Corporation earns a Buy rating, supported by robust fundamentals, a reasonable valuation, and technical chart breakout potential.
* NVDA trades at a forward P/E of ~27x, well below dot-com bubble levels, with a forward PEG of 1.08x, reflecting sustained high growth.
* Management maintains visibility to $500 billion in Blackwell and Rubin revenue through 2026, with upside potential from new GPU agreements.
* Low implied volatility makes NVDA call options attractive, while competitive risks from Google are notable but manageable near-term.

Nvidia Corporation ([NVDA](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/NVDA "NVIDIA Corporation")) stock looks ready to move higher, as the fundamentals continue to be strong, the valuation is reasonable, and the chart may be starting to break out. To top things off, NVDA option prices are

3.19KFollowers

I prefer to look for GARP (growth at a reasonable price) stocks but also look for opportunities everywhere else. I don't have a specified time horizon. I invest in a stock for as long as my thesis holds true, and I get out when the facts change. In addition, I've developed market-beating algorithms with Python that have helped me find attractive investment opportunities within my own portfolio, and I have been investing since 2016.On top of that, I've worked at TipRanks as an analysis/news writer and even as an editor for a few years, which not only kept me on top of the market but also helped me understand what people are interested in reading. Further, as an editor, I learned to pay attention to detail and found that there's plenty of misinformation and "fluff" out there that needs to be corrected. Thus, my goal is to provide accurate and useful information to the best of my abilities.I was previously associated with Investor's Compass.

**Analyst‚Äôs Disclosure:**I/we have a beneficial long

content:
Before we get to the technical numbers, let‚Äôs take a quick look at the fundamentals:

Nvidia posted $46.7 billion in revenue in its second fiscal quarter‚Äîa 6% increase from Q126 and 56% year-over-year. The data center segment accounted for $41.1 billion, also up 56% from the previous year.

Source: InvestingPro [...] NVDA is technically classified as Vision AI,
 Look at the fundamental fair value,
 Check how healthy the balance sheet and cash flows are,
 and compare the stock in the context of other AI beneficiaries - all in one setup.

## Conclusion: Nvidia is the test - WarrenAI is your tool

Whether Nvidia will ignite another AI rally after the US stock market closes today, or whether skepticism towards AI trading will continue to grow, nobody knows. title: 5 Metrics Capture Nvidia's Mind-Boggling Growth
content:
The quarter was impressive by every measure. Nvidia's revenue growth accelerated again, profitability remained unusually high for a chipmaker, the company continued buying back its stock, and management guided for a huge sequential step-up in sales.

Taken together, five metrics from the company's third-quarter fiscal 2026 report capture just how quickly the business is scaling, showing what's behind Wall Street's love for the stock this year.

A room full of computer servers. [...] Management's fourth-quarter guidance offers another window into Nvidia's momentum. Management expects revenue of $65.0 billion, plus or minus 2%. Using last year's fourth-quarter revenue of $39.3 billion as the base, the midpoint implies roughly 65% year-over-year growth and about 14% sequential growth from the latest quarter.

## 5. Soaring earnings [...] Image source: Getty Images.

## 1. Accelerating revenue growth

The first number that stands out in Nvidia's third-quarter report is its revenue of $57.0
raw_content:
![The Motley Fool](https://g.foolcdn.com/misc-assets/logo-tmf-primary-1-magenta-purple-reversed.svg?_w=320)
![The Motley Fool](https://g.foolcdn.com/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fg.foolcdn.com%2Fmisc-assets%2Ftmf_holdingco_logo_stacked_magenta_royalpurple_rev.png&w=96&op=resize)

# 5 Metrics Capture Nvidia's Mind-Boggling Growth

## Key Points

## [NASDAQ: NVDA](/quote/nasdaq/nvda/)

### Nvidia

![Nvidia Stock Quote](https://g.foolcdn.com/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fg.foolcdn.com%2Fart%2Fcompanylogos%2Fmark%2FNVDA.png&w=128&op=resize)

Wondering why Nvidia stock has crushed the market this year? These metrics break it down.

In the debate over whether [AI (artificial intelligence)](https://www.fool.com/terms/a/artificial-intelligence/) spending is peaking or only getting started, **Nvidia** ([NVDA](/quote/nasdaq/nvda/) +1.09%) just delivered another quarter that strongly supports the latter view. The AI chip specialist reported record results, pointing to a still-growing pipeline of demand as cloud providers race to build new AI infrastructure.

The quarter was impressive by every measure. [Nvidia](https://www.fool.com/investing/how-to-invest/stocks/how-to-invest-in-nvidia-stock/)'s revenue growth accelerated again, profitability remained unusually high for a chipmaker, the company continued buying back its stock, and management guided for a huge sequential step-up in sales.

Taken together, five metrics from the company's third-quarter fiscal 2026 report capture just how quickly the business is scaling, showing what's behind Wall Street's love for the stock this year.

![A room full of computer servers.](https://g.foolcdn.com/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fg.foolcdn.com%2Feditorial%2Fimages%2F844423%2Fis-nvda-sock-a-buyy-now-nvidia.jpg&w=3840&op=resize)

Image source: Getty Images.

## 1. Accelerating revenue growth

The first number that stands out in Nvidia's third-quarter report is its revenue of $57.0 billion, up 62% year over year and 22% versus the second quarter of fiscal 2026. Importantly, that growth rate marked Nvidia's first year-over-year revenue growth acceleration after six straight quarters of deceleration.

Data center revenue did most of the heavy lifting. Sales in that segment reached $51.2 billion -- an increase of 66% from a year earlier and 25% sequentially, as customers bought more Blackwell-generation accelerators and high-bandwidth networking hardware to power AI training and inference workloads.

Data center products now account for almost all of Nvidia's growth, showing how central the company has become to modern AI infrastructure.

## 2. Staggering margins

Rapid top-line growth would be far less impressive if it came with heavy discounting. Yet Nvidia's gross margins remain unusually strong. On a [non-GAAP](https://www.fool.com/investing/how-to-invest/stocks/gaap-vs-non-gaap/) basis, third-quarter gross margin was 73.6%, up from 72.7% in the second quarter.

On a similar note, non-GAAP [operating income](https://www.fool.com/terms

title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Third Quarter ...
content:
Record revenue of $57.0 billion, up 22% from Q2 and up 62% from a year ago
   Record Data Center revenue of $51.2 billion, up 25% from Q2 and up 66% from a year ago

NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA) today reported record revenue for the third quarter ended October 26, 2025, of $57.0 billion, up 22% from the previous quarter and up 62% from a year ago.

For the quarter, GAAP and non-GAAP gross margins were 73.4% and 73.6%, respectively. [...] Third-quarter revenue was a record $51.2 billion, up 25% from the previous quarter and up 66% from a year ago.
   Revealed that NVIDIA Blackwell achieved the highest performance and best overall efficiency in the SemiAnalysis InferenceMAX benchmarks, while delivering 10x throughput per megawatt compared with the previous generation.
   Announced a strategic partnership with OpenAI to deploy at least 10 gigawatts of NVIDIA systems for OpenAI‚Äôs next-generation AI infrastructure.

title: Nvidia Stock Financials & Fundamental Analysis - StockInvest.us
content: In the last financial report for NVIDIA, released Wednesday 26th of February 2025, the company posted a revenue of $130.50 billion, up 114.20% from last year's revenue of $60.92 billion. The company spent $32.64 billion on producing its products, and the gross revenue ended at $97.86 billion with a exceptional profit margin of 74.99%. The production cost grew by 96.37 % in the period, while the gross profit grew by 120.89%. The result after financial and other costs ended at $72.88 billion, [...] giving a positive profit margin of 55.85% and an earnings per share (EPS) of $2.97. The EPS came in 0.612% over the analyst's estimate of $2.95. Since the report was published 9 months ago, NVIDIA has risen 44.13% and currently holds a price of $189.21.

Nvidia is rated a strong buy, driven by its dominant AI infrastructure position and accelerating GPU architectures amid the end of Moore's Law.
 NVDA's revenue momentum is underpinned by a $0.5 trillion Blackwell/Rubin pipeline, robust hyperscaler demand, and a projected 40% long-term CAGR.
 Key risks include China export controls, power constraints, customer concentration, and potential re-rating if open-source AI or custom silicon erode demand. [...] The strong buy rating is supported by Nvidia‚Äôs dominant AI hardware/software moat, 15x Blackwell throughput leap, $0.5T revenue pipeline, and robust hyperscaler demand, with technicals favoring accumulation on dips.
 China export controls and power scarcity could cut NVDA revenue by 15‚Äì25% by 2027, especially if Chinese firms shift to domestic chips or hyperscalers adopt custom silicon, warranting close monitoring.

## Summary

* Nvidia is rated a strong buy, driven by its dominant AI infrastructure position and accelerating GPU architectures amid the end of Moore's Law.
* NVDA's revenue momentum is underpinned by a $0.5 trillion Blackwell/Rubin pipeline, robust hyperscaler demand, and a projected 40% long-term CAGR.
* Key risks include China export controls, power constraints, customer concentration, and potential re-rating if open-source AI or custom silicon erode demand.
* I recommend accumulating NVDA on dips ($140.7‚Äì$164.3), monitoring GAIN AI Act progress, Chinese chipmaker advances, and new Saudi data center partnerships.

As per my analysis, NVIDIA Corporation ([NVDA](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/NVDA "NVIDIA Corporation")) is currently attached with a strong buy rating, being the largest AI infrastructure (hardware + software) supplier. title: If You'd Invested $100 in Nvidia 10 Years Ago, Here's How Much ...
content:
The chipmaker's shares have been lifted by its robust fundamentals. Revenue and net income skyrocketed by 4,285% and 12,867%, respectively, between its fiscal Q3 2016 and its fiscal Q3 2026 (which ended Oct. 26). Nvidia is now the world's most valuable company, sporting a market cap of $4.4 trillion.

Advertisement

Some investors fear that we're in an AI bubble. Should spending on AI infrastructure slow down, it could have a negative effect on Nvidia's impressive growth trajectory.

Nvidia has been a lucrative pick-and-shovel investment opportunity in the AI boom.

**Nvidia** ([NVDA](/quote/nasdaq/nvda/) +1.09%) has deservedly gotten much attention in recent years thanks to its dominant position in the market for data center graphics processing units (GPUs). The business sells the high-end parallel processing chips that tech companies need to power artificial intelligence (AI) models. It's a legitimate [pick-and-shovel investment play](https://www.fool.com/terms/p/pick-and-shovel/).

The stock has been a big winner, and not just since the AI trend took off. If you'd invested $100 in Nvidia 10 years ago and held on through the ups and downs that followed, here's how much your investment would be worth today.

Image source: Nvidia.

## Nvidia shares have gone parabolic

In the past decade, Nvidia shares have produced a monster total return of 22,980% (as of Dec. 19), which would have turned a $100 investment into a holding worth more than $23,000. The company does pay a small dividend, currently just $0.01 per share quarterly, that has had a tiny effect on investor gains.

Nvidia has crushed the **S&P

title: Nvidia Stock Had a Volatile 2025: What's the 2026 Forecast?
content:
Consensus estimates call for Nvidia‚Äôs revenues to rise 63% to $213.2 billion in the current fiscal year, which would end in January 2026, and then rise by almost 50% to $319 billion in the next fiscal year. There could be more upside to these already splendid numbers if Nvidia‚Äôs China business gets back on track. Nvidia trades at a forward price-to-earnings (P/E) multiple of 42.9x while its P/E-to-growth (PEG) multiple is 0.92, which makes it the only Magnificent 7 constituent to have a PEG [...] Nvidia stock (NVDA) is up 41.88% year-to-date and is the second-best performing constituent of the ‚ÄúMagnificent 7‚Äù stocks, trailing only Alphabet (GOOG) (GOOGL), whose 2025 price action surprised even some of the bulls. While Nvidia‚Äôs 2025 returns ‚Äì which are well above twice the average S&P 500 Index ($SPX) constituent ‚Äì would look stellar, they pale in front of the triple-digit returns that it delivered in the previous two years. # Nvidia Stock Had a Volatile 2025: What‚Äôs the 2026 Forecast?

All information and data in this article is solely for informational purposes. For more information please view the Barchart Disclosure Policy [here](https://www.barchart.com/terms#disclosure)

Share

![Nvidia logo on phone screen with stock chart by xalien via Shutterstock](https://media.barchart.com/contributors-admin/common-images/images/Tech%20(Ecommerce%2C%20Social%20Media%2C%20etc.)/Nvidia%20logo%20on%20phone%20screen%20with%20stock%20chart%20by%20xalien%20via%20Shutterstock.jpg)

Nvidia stock [(NVDA)](https://www.barchart.com/quotes/NVDA) is up [41.88% year-to-date](https://www.barchart.com/stocks/quotes/NVDA/performance) and is the second-best performing constituent of the ‚ÄúMagnificent 7‚Äù stocks, trailing only [Alphabet](https://www.barchart.com/story/news/36458523/how-to-play-goog-stock-as-google-gemini-sends-a-chill-down-sam-altmans-spine) [(GOOG)](https://www.barchart.com/quotes/GOOG) [(GOOGL)](https://www.barchart.com/quotes/GOOGL), whose 2025 price action surprised even some of the bulls. While Nvidia‚Äôs 2025 returns ‚Äì which are well above twice the average S&P 500 Index [($SPX)](https://www.barchart.com/quotes/$SPX) constituent ‚Äì would look stellar, they pale in front of the triple-digit returns that it delivered in the previous two years.

Nvidia stock was quite volatile this year and [plunged to $86.62 on April 7 amid U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs tariffs](https://www.barchart.com/story/news/31737380/is-nvidia-stock-a-buy-or-sell-below-100-as-a-global-trade-war-escalates). The rebound was also quick, though, and the stock has more than doubled from its 2025 lows even as it is down 11.37% from the record high of $212.19 in late October.

![](https://barchart-news-media-prod.aws.barchart.com/EXCLSV/99a84a33511e6065f1d40c009291d162/lent1ykbjmxw3crz.png)

## Nvidia Announced Multiple Deals in 2025

Nvidia went on a [deal-making spree](https://www.barchart.com/story/news/35040319/nvidia-is-on-a-dealmaking-spree-should-you-buy-nvda-stock-amid-fears-of-an-ai-bubble) in 2025, announcing a flurry of investments.¬†Among others, it reported an investment of up to $100 billion in OpenAI, [$5 billion in Intel](https://www.barchart.com/story/news/34957995/smart-money-cant-get-enough-of-intel-stock-should-you-buy-a-piece-of-the-intc-pie-too) [(INTC)](https://www.barchart.com/quotes/INTC), $10 billion in Anthropic, $1 billion in Nokia [(NOK)](https://www.barchart.com/quotes/NOK), $2 billion in Synopsis [(SNPS)](https://www.barchart.com/quotes/SNPS), and also participated in funding rounds of several other companies this year. In addition, it

title: The Complete Ticker: NVDA Stock Analysis From IPO To AI's Center ...
content: For readers seeking NVDA stock analysis that feels grounded rather than breathless, the lesson is simple. The company‚Äôs impact has come from choices that stretched over years, not quarters. CUDA in 2006. Titan in 2012. Mellanox in 2020. Hopper in 2022. Blackwell previewed in March 2024. The numbers that followed, like revenue growth of 101 percent in August 2023 and 262 percent in May 2024, were the echoes of those decisions. The market noticed. The culture did too. And somewhere between the [...] failed megadeal, and one of the most explosive bursts of revenue growth Silicon Valley has ever seen. [...] quarter reported on August 23, 2023, revenue reached $13.51 billion, up 101 percent year over year, as the data center segment took off. By May 22, 2024, the company reported first quarter fiscal 2025 revenue of $26.0 billion, up 262 percent from a year earlier.
